page.title: 13ECOLOGY OF ALSTON MOOR
page.content: Mainly {rough fell-grazing}is to the west,with heathers,grasses and the usual moorland flowers like tormentil, thyme and heath bedstraw,ferns and mosses in gullies,sedges and sphagnums in marshes.{Valley floor vegetation} includes rowan,blaeberry and crowberry and ubiquitous nettle with marsh marigolds and common meadow flowers. Riverside trees are alder,ash,willow, sycamore,wych elm(now under attack) and spruces.Railway embankments have ox-eye daisies and orchids.On steep woodland are toothwort and bluebells. In the{town}are walls with yellow corydalis and feverfew,crucifers and welsh poppies.Migrant{birds}are curlews,peewits,warblers and cuckoos then swallows,swifts and martins,black caps,red polls and snipe.Animals include hedgehogs,hares,rabbits,roe- deer,badgers,foxes,mice,shrew,voles.
